More towers in Naxal-hit areas

Working against odds to improve poor telephone connectivity, the government has set up 1,356 mobile towers in Maoist-hit areas, benefiting thousands and security personnel in remote regions.

The towers were installed by the State-run BSNL as part of an ambitious project to install 2,199 mobile towers in nine Maoist-hit States by this March end. An additional 175 mobile towers were sanctioned by the Home Ministry for installation recently. — PTI
title: Govt. installs 1,356 mobile towers in Naxal-hit areas
